scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes Xforms 2.0 in their national catalogue with The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
The purpose of Xforms is not related to the publication of public data as open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

Xforms 2.0 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/community/xformsusers/wiki/XForms_2.0

criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specificationÂ
statement:
W3C has a defined and publicly available Process for the Development and approval process of the specification as a recommended standard. Also, a clear Release Notes tracking the changes of the different versions is archived.

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

statement:

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
XForms specification became an official W3C Recommendation on 14 October 2003. It has been evolved over the years with versions updates demonstrating that it overcame the possible issues raised on the development and implementation.

Xforms 2.0 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/community/xformsusers/wiki/XForms_2.0

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
Xforms was updated to version 2.0 in 2010 and has the full support from the W3C group, an international community where Member organizations, a full-time staff, and the public work together to develop Web standards.

Xforms 2.0 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/community/xformsusers/wiki/XForms_2.0

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
Xforms 2.0 is an XML format used for collecting inputs from web forms. Although it is used in a wide variety of solutions, it does not foster the creation of innovative solutions.

Xforms 2.0 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/community/xformsusers/wiki/XForms_2.0

statement:

Developer community W3C:
https://www.w3.org/Consortium/

criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
By allowing public administrations to have online forms to interact with the population, Xforms fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of public administrations and services.

Xforms 2.0 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/community/xformsusers/wiki/XForms_2.0

https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/w3c-standards-and-technical-reports/solution/xforms-20

criterion_description: The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
Xforms 2.0 can be used independently of any other technical specifications or operating system. However, Xforms is based on XML, so it can be dependent on conventions and rules for the correct XML usage. 

Xforms 2.0 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/community/xformsusers/wiki/XForms_2.0

criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
Xforms 2.0 is an XML markup for a new generation of forms and other applications on the Web. An XForms-based application gathers and processes data using an architecture that separates presentation, purpose and content.

Xforms 2.0 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/community/xformsusers/wiki/XForms_2.0

criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
The specification is aimed to participate in the evaluation of access policies, participating in authentication processes that can ease the secure and trustworthy exchange of data. For security reasons, the XForms Processor must not dereference the URI bound to this form control without explicit user permission.

Xforms 2.0 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/community/xformsusers/wiki/XForms_2.0

criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are many documents that evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of this specification. For example, in the following link there is a study of Xforms called "Efficient evaluation of shared predicates for XForms page access control".

Xforms evaluation:
https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/4766728

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
Xforms 2.0 is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, Xforms can define the interoperability aspects of the Forms Management Component", and  "Forms Management Service" ABBs of the EIRA Technical Infraestructure View.

EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement: After searching for a certification or conformity test to validate Xforms 2.0 no tool has been found that assess the conformity of the specification. However, there are tools that validate the previous version of Xforms, version 1.1.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification is recommended by an EU Member State.
statement:
There are no Member States recommending Xforms 2.0 in their ICT National Catalogues. However, Germany is recommending a previous version, Xforms 1.1.
 
CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

The purpose of Xforms is not related to organisational interoperability. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

Xforms 2.0 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/community/xformsusers/wiki/XForms_2.0

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
The Xforms 2.0 includes data structures and models that can be considered as reusable models for establishing data policies, the data involved and the processes involved. 

Xforms 2.0 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/community/xformsusers/wiki/XForms_2.0

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
The purpose of Xforms is not related to the publication of public data as linked open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

Xforms 2.0 W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/community/xformsusers/wiki/XForms_2.0

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
